definitions.definition: used when the speaker or writer is also the person affected by an action

examples.text: I cut myself on a knife.
I wrote a message to myself.
I found myself unable to speak.
I haven't been feeling myself recently *(= I have not felt well)*.
I needed space to be myself *(= not influenced by other people)*.

definitions.definition: used to emphasize the fact that the speaker is doing something

examples.text: I painted the room all by myself.

definitions.definition: for the speaker or writer alone to have or use; not shared

examples.text: I had a whole pizza to myself.

wordOrigin: Old English me self, from the pronoun me + the adjective self; the change of me to my occurred in Middle English.
